intro: Macroscepis macrocorolla, commonly known as the giant spider lily, is a striking plant native to the wetlands of Florida and the Caribbean. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with a distinctive red stripe down the center. The plant features strap-like, grassy leaves that grow from a bulbous base, typical of many Amaryllidaceae species. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as beetles and flies. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
